content:
#22097 adds one-way aliases for disjoint_left and disjoint_right so for h : Disjoint s t and hx : x ∈ s, one can write h.not_mem_of_mem_left hx to prove x ∉ t.

I discovered while making this PR that this is the same as (disjoint_left.1 h) hx, but this won't show up with autocomplete, and neither exact? nor aesop finds it. (I've been using Disjoint for years without realizing it was there, and doing a horrible hack in its place).
